intro: Brassica oleracea subvar. praecox, commonly known as early broccoli, is a cool-season crop belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, compact inflorescence of green, unopened flower buds that are harvested before they bloom. The plant typically grows to a height of 40–60 cm and has dark green, lobed leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires consistent moisture during its growing season. This variety is often cultivated for its nutritional value and is a common ingredient in many cuisines worldwide.
